thread.title: Softball | Great Bridge looking another title
thread.title_full: Softball preview | Great Bridge looking another title | HamptonRoads.com | PilotOnline.com

author: Larry Rubama
title: Softball | Great Bridge looking another title
text:
FIVE PLAYERS YOU SHOULD KNOW Meaghan Barfield, First Colonial Hard-hitting infielder belted 12 homers and batted .448 as a sophomore and was first-team All-Tidewater last season.
Lauren Duff, Hickory First-team All-Tidewater pick and the PenSouth Conference Player of the Year batted .547.
Sydney Harless, Great Bridge 2014 All-Tidewater Player of the Year as a junior, finished 26-1 with a 0.14 ERA to lead the Wildcats to the Group 5A state title.
KateLynn Hodgkiss, Nansemond River Batted .540 and was named first-team all-state and second-team All-Tidewater last season.
Jac Mounie, Nansemond River First-team All-Tidewater and the Ironclad Conference Player of the Year last season.
GROUP 6A
In the Coastal Conference ...
First Colonial returns P Jenna Powell, who was 22-5 with a 0.98 ERA and recorded eight shutouts last season. The Patriots also have big hitters in juniors Meaghan Barfield and Skylar Johnston, who totaled 21 homers, 56 runs and 76 RBIs. Others veterans include C Ali Hagedorn, 2B Kyndall Hagedorn and CF Chelsea Updegraff. ... Landstown coach Angela Tonnesen has seven seniors but also three freshmen will make an immediate impact. Leading the way are INF Catie Knapp (.309), C Haley Hinton (.514, 38 hits) and SS Imani Myint (.444).
In the Monitor-Merrimac Conference ...
Grassfield coach Leroy Bohn said this year’s team “will only go as far as our pitching will take us.” The Grizzlies will count on Rhiannon Wynn, Kristen Harkins and Tyra Workman. ... Western Branch will rely on the pitching of Becky Rusch (2.10 ERA) and a strong defense helped by SS Kristen Creekmore. Offensively, the Bruins will lean on seniors Jessica Smith (.514) and Tiffany Ellison.
___
GROUP 5A
In the Atlantic Conference ...
Kempsville promoted coach Matt Brinton from junior varsity, where he compiled a 97-33 record in 13 seasons. But he has huge shoes to fill as he replaces longtime coach Dean Spruill, who led the Chiefs for 20 years. ... Norview coach Kirsten Allen celebrates her 20th season. The Pilots return several key players, including seniors Jamie Cook and Allie Hill. ... Princess Anne legendary coach Dennis Nixon begins his 30th season and is 32 victories shy of 500. But he is concerned about depth as only 13 players tried out and he cut only one. “Doesn’t look good,” he said. The Cavaliers return juniors Sydney Hill, Victoria Legge and Meaghan Craig.
In the PenSouth Conference ...
Great Bridge is the favorite to repeat as Group 5A state champs as long as P Sydney Harless is on the circle. The Wildcats also return OF Cameryn Strother (.425), 2B Sarah Cimring (.310) and OF Laura Yawn (.309). ... Hickory has a senior-laden squad led by C Lauren Duff, a two-time All-Tidewater selection. Coach Ryan Wieck calls her “a true five-tool athlete, fast, strong and the best arm I’ve ever seen.” Other seniors: P Kandis Kresinske, 1B Addy Brooks, SS Sarah Martin, OF Maggie Miller, P Lora Beth O’Connor, 3B Skylar Dudley and OF Amy Sykes. ... Indian River is led by twins Alexandra (.400) and Alejandra Illa (.308). The Braves also will rely on OF Shea Alheit (.371).
___
STORYLINES
GROUP 4A
In Conference 17 ...
Churchland will count on SS Cheyanne Horne and P Helen Anne Bradshaw (8-6, 2.01 ERA, 70 K’s). ... Lake Taylor welcomes back former coach Rich Thomas. Players to watch include Ashleigh Beaird, Candice Salazar and Maranda Forstrom. ... Wilson is led by P Skylar Swain, C Cher Jamison, INF Corin Fulcher and INF Alyssa Jamerson.
In the Ironclad Conference ...
King’s Fork lost three key players to graduation and another two to injuries. But P Sydney Wash returns after going 13-7 with a 2.05 ERA and 135 Ks last season. SS Jasmine Holloman (.416), OF Kay’Lee Justice and 2B Kirsten Wuchter also will contribute. ... Lakeland will be very young this season but coach Cara Byrd is expecting big things from 2B Brittany Strickland, 3B Alex Kinsey and C Makayla Dickens. The Cavaliers also return starters SS Stasha Waterfield and P Tori Abel. ... Nansemond River returns its entire starting lineup from last season, a team that went 10-0 in the conference and 22-3 overall. The Warriors return two all-state players in INF KateLynn Hodgkiss (.540, .655 OBP) and OF Morgan Lowers (.500, .569 OBP). INF Jac Mounie (.519) was the Ironclad Player of the Year, while OF Lauren Davis (.417), C Calah Savage (.412), UTL Katelyn Biando (.577) and P Lauren Maddrey (15-1, 1.40 ERA) were all-region players.
___
In private schools ...
Greenbrier Christian will miss standout P Kayla Harris, a two-time All-Tidewater selection and the 2013 All-Tidewater Player of the Year. Gators coach Danny Moore said this team will be “talented” and will rely offensively on Selena Thompson (.548) and lean on Savannah Jackson (7-2) on the circle. “This will be one of the youngest teams we have had but we are confident in Savannah’s abilities on the mound and with Selena’s senior leadership to help us again compete for the TCIS and VISAA championships.” ... Nansemond-Suffolk will rely on Lakeland transfer Katie Peelen and freshman Emerson Puzey on the mound, while Delaney Taylor (.523), Brooklyne Carr (.500) and freshmen Dani Goodman and Madi Wilson should lead the Saints offensively. ... Norfolk Academy will be led by SS Dillon Cullipher (.393) and 3B Olivia Behling. Newcomers to watch include Amberly Butler and Sarah Werner. ... Portsmouth Christian returns everybody from a team that finished second in the conference and fourth in the VISAA Division III tournament, including P Sandy Taylor, OF Sydney Bovat, C Destanee Cutler and utility player Tori Knox.
Larry Rubama, 757-446-2273
larry.rubama@pilotonline.com
Twitter: @LHRubama
 3 photos: Great Bridge’s Sydney Harless pitches to Hickory’s Claire Murphy on Friday, March 28, 2014. Harless tallied nine strikeouts as she and the top-ranked Wildcats ran their records to 3-0. (Steve Earley 3 TOP TEAMS IN SOUTH HAMPTON ROADS 1. Great Bridge: Wildcats are the defending 5A state champions and return star P Sydney Harless.
2. Nansemond River: Warriors are deep and return entire starting lineup.
3. First Colonial: Patriots are the defending Coastal Conference regular-season and tournament champions.
4. Hickory: Hawks will be tough with the battery of C Lauren Duff and P Kandis Kresinske.
5. Landstown: Eagles are experienced with seven seniors.
6. Kellam: The Knights are always tough.
7. Greenbrier Christian: Gators have won six straight VISAA state titles.
8. King’s Fork: Bulldogs will ride the arm of senior P Sydney Wash.
9. Ocean Lakes: Dolphins lost ace Kaitlyn Lehan to graduation but will still be talented.
10. Bayside: Marlins look to build off of last season’s success.
Posted to : Sports
